list_definition.definition: an organ of the body, close to the stomach, which causes changes in the blood.

list_ex_of_english: However, beaked whales have much larger spleens than delphinids, and may have larger livers as well.
Mixed infections were pathogenic to the mice, whose livers and spleens were substantially enlarged.
At necropsy, the spleen was removed, cleaned of other tissue and weighed to the nearest 1 mg.
The thoracic and the abdominal organs were mirror-imaged, with a spleen of normal size found on the right.
In areas where malaria is endemic, spontaneous rupture of spleen is uncommon.
The thoracic and abdominal organs were arranged in mirror-imaged fashion, with a spleen of normal size on the right.
In another recent study of patients with heterotaxy syndrome, 74 17 of 20 patients did not exhibit a spleen by magnetic resonance imaging.
Livers, spleens and hearts were dissected and weighed.
